intro.Run: In this tutorial you will learn a number of essential ReSharper shortcuts that you will probably use most often in your day-to-day work. The goal of this tutorial is only to give you a "taste" of ReSharper. All these shortcuts will be covered in next tutorials in more details.

text.p: Used to apply quick fixes to inspections ("squigglies"), or apply context specific actions, depending on location of text caret. Also allows searching and applying all ReSharper commands direct from the menu.
Icon is displayed in gutter margin on left of editor, e.g. yellow lightbulb to fix warning, red light bulb to fix error, hammer to context action, etc.
The badlyNamedClass class doesn't match ReSharper's naming style! Let's fix this:

ol.li: Place text caret on "squiggly". Note the lightbulb in the margin on the left.
Click the light bulb, or hit Alt+Enter.
Select Rename to 'BadlyNamedClass' to apply the fix.
Place text caret on arg. Note the hammer action - a context action is available.
Place caret on GoToAction class name.
Hit Alt+Enter. Note the magnifying glass.

text.p: Say, we want to take a look at the SomeClass declaration.

ol.li: Place text caret on the SomeClass in the field declaration.
Hit Ctrl + B (VS) to navigate to type declaration.

text.p: Thanks for passing the tutorial. Now you can proceed to the next tutorial that will show you ReSharper navigation tricks.
